unnormalised: The Delhi govt. has announced a new scholarship scheme for students scoring above 90% in their Class 12 exams. The scheme, named "Shiksha Udan," will provide Rs. 25,000 per year for undergraduate studies. Application forms will be available online from 15/07/2024.
normalised: The Delhi government has announced a new scholarship scheme for students scoring above ninety percent in their Class twelve exams. The scheme, named "Shiksha Udan," will provide rupee twenty five thousand per year for undergraduate studies. Application forms will be available online from fifteenth July two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal stated that this initiative aims to support meritorious students, irrespective of their economic background. He further added that this will reduce the dropout rate, which currently stands at approx. 15% for underprivileged students pursuing higher education. The scheme is expected to benefit over 10,000 students in the first year itself.
normalised: Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal stated that this initiative aims to support meritorious students, irrespective of their economic background. He further added that this will reduce the dropout rate, which currently stands at approximately fifteen percent for underprivileged students pursuing higher education. The scheme is expected to benefit over ten thousand students in the first year itself.

unnormalised: According to sources in the Education Dept., the funds will be directly transferred to the students’ bank accounts via DBT. Students can apply for the "Shiksha Udan" scheme through the official website: www.delhigovtedu.nic.in. The last date for submitting applications is 31/08/2024.
normalised: According to sources in the Education Department, the funds will be directly transferred to the students’ bank accounts via D-B-T. Students can apply for the "Shiksha Udan" scheme through the official website: w-w-w dot delhigovtedu dot nic dot in. The last date for submitting applications is thirty first August two thousand and twenty four.
